se.jguru.nazgul.core.parser.api

Interface TokenDefinitions

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTokenDefinitions, SingleBracketTokenDefinitions

    public interface TokenDefinitions
    Specification for how to identify tokens (within text), as well as how to get the actual name from the token when a Pattern match is found.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getToken(String tokenMatch)
      Retrieves the actual token name from a match from the getTokenRegExpPattern() Pattern, i.e. with any token start and token end sequences peeled off.
      Pattern getTokenRegExpPattern()
      Retrieves a Regular expression which can be used by a TokenParser to identify tokens within text.

    • Method Detail

      • getTokenRegExpPattern

        Pattern getTokenRegExpPattern()
        Retrieves a Regular expression which can be used by a TokenParser to identify tokens within text.
        Returns:
        a Regular expression which can be used by a TokenParser to identify tokens within text. Will never return a null Pattern.

      • getToken

        String getToken(String tokenMatch)
        Retrieves the actual token name from a match from the getTokenRegExpPattern() Pattern, i.e. with any token start and token end sequences peeled off. For example, if a Token should be recognized using ${aToken}, then this method would return aToken (i.e. without any start or end delimiter chars).
        Parameters:
        tokenMatch - The matched string from the getTokenRegExpPattern() Pattern.
        Returns:
        The name of the token embedded in the tokenMatch argument String.
